AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Magistrate Judge: court official responsible for the report and recommendation, signed the document
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: conducted a vehicle stop as part of an investigation into human smuggling, operated the Freer immigration checkpoint, noticed drop-offs on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to avoid checkpoints, monitors traffic on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 which is mostly used by ranchers and oil field workers, followed suspicious vehicles, recognizes vehicles associated with the wind farm on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, identified rental cars as commonly used by smugglers, observed a white Malibu sedan with suspicious behavior, stopped a vehicle transporting illegals, received a phone call regarding a traffic stop and arrived at the scene, transported an individual to the Freer immigration checkpoint for further questioning, conducted the initial traffic stop and had an agent present during interviews, interviewed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. after he waived his rights, conducted a roving stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., governed by the standard articulated in reasonable suspicion cases, stopped vehicles near the United States-Mexico border, familiar with most of the ordinary traffic in a sparsely populated area like Farm-to-Market Road 2050, aware that Farm-to-Market Road 2050 is frequently used to circumvent checkpoints, has agents with experience in detecting illegal entry and smuggling, considered driving patterns such as traveling in tandem as indicative of potential smuggling activity, followed the black Dodge pickup truck for about five minutes and the white Malibu sedan for a little while after running each of their plates, conducted a roving stop based on observations of passenger behavior, used reasonable suspicion standard to investigate suspicious activities, obtained consent to search a vehicle from an individual who exhibited extreme nervousness, transported IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. to the Freer immigration checkpoint for further questioning, knew about Agent Trevino's encounter with illegals in a white Malibu sedan on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, had sufficient evidence to conclude that two vehicles were driving in tandem and thus had probable cause to arrest, agents were to arrive, noted that smugglers frequently use rental cars
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Police Department: conducted a traffic stop that led to an arrest and subsequent motion to suppress, employed Officer Reymundo Reyes who conducted a traffic stop based on a BOLO for a black Dodge pickup truck, interacted with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. during the stop, issued a citation, had an officer arrive as another officer was writing a citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where motions to suppress were filed and heard, has a District Judge with authority to review and decide on motions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth: rental car company whose vehicles were used by smugglers, registered a white sedan involved in suspicious activity on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: Received a phone call regarding an attempted alien smuggling event, bears the burden of proving that stops were constitutional when defendants are seized without a warrant, prohibits unreasonable searches and seizures
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals: court jurisdiction that has addressed similar cases and established standards for analyzing probable cause in tandem vehicle cases, noted that the order of vehicles in a smuggling venture is not significant
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico border: geographical boundary used as a factor in determining reasonable suspicion for United States Border Patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Echo 43 checkpoint: checkpoint within fifty miles of the Mexico border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: the highest court in the land that has long held that reasonableness is the touchstone of analysis, referenced in discussion of previous cases regarding traffic stops, refused to authorize investigative interrogations at law enforcement stations on less than probable cause or consent
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol station: location where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was transported for questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Constitution: supreme law of the land that outlines the framework of the US government and the relationship between the government and its citizens, including protections against unreasonable searches and seizures
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.law enforcement officer: official responsible for enforcing laws and maintaining public order, may conduct arrests and gather evidence in the course of their duties
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the court proceedings are taking place
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who encountered illegals in a white Malibu sedan on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and was unaware of Corinth, Texas location at the time of stop, testified about his observations during the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ford Motor Company: truck manufacturer, commonly used by oil companies for their vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: vehicle with five passengers, stopped by Agent Trevino who presumed it was riding low due to the number of people inside
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who testified during cross-examination about his lack of knowledge regarding the Moglia ranch house and Stag trailer occupants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who conducted a traffic stop, could not recall when IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was informed that a canine would conduct a search, has impounded vehicles within his discretion for lack of proof of insurance, arrived as another officer was writing a citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reyes and Hugo Benavides: officers who recalled the timing of their arrival during a traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge pickup truck: vehicle mentioned with no contribution to reasonable suspicion due to its low ride height
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Benavides: United States Border Patrol agent who asked IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. questions en route to the United States Border Patrol station, used bad language and made threats during the conversation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: United States Magistrate Judge who does not consider the fact that the black Dodge pickup truck was riding low as contributing to reasonable suspicion for a traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation: state agency responsible for preparing district traffic maps and determining traffic flow data
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation, Lare: division of the Texas Department of Transportation that collected and determined traffic flow data
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz: rental car company with locations at airports, including the Laredo International Airport, where vehicles are rented and may be registered to different cities or states
